definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
judge's desk/complex legal case/contentious issue/koan (Zen Buddhism)

Dee Gong An (or Judge Dee's) Cases, 18th century fantasy featuring Tang dynasty politician Di Renjie 狄仁傑|狄仁杰[Di2 Ren2 jie2] as master sleuth, translated by R.H. van Gulik as Three Murder Cases Solved by Judge Dee
sutra written on leaves of pattra palm tree
a misjudged legal case/a miscarriage (of justice)
unjust, fake and false charges (in a legal case)
a huge amount (of books and papers)
(of a body of people) to offer all kinds of different opinions (idiom)/to argue endlessly
Dreyfus affair 1894-1906, notorious political scandal in France case involving antisemitism and miscarriage of justice
pinyin: De2 lei2 fu2 si1 an4 jian4
